website_summaries.verdict: A useful 8-port Ethernet switch that delivers speedy wired connectivity.
pros: Has 8 ports, so it's perfect for heavy use or offices
Easy to plug in and use right out of the box
Doesn't run hot and offers durable a metal build
Online support is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
cons: Sensitive connections that come disconnected when the unit is bumped or moved are possible

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! The 8 port model SE3008 design has changed dramatically as of July 2018
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE! The 8 port model SE3008 design has changed dramatically from what is described. There is now a SE3008V2 which is completely different. I ordered 2 of these units on 7/17/2018 specifically for the orientation of front panel lights and rear panel ethernet and power jacks. Unfortunately I was shipped model SE3008V2, which has all lights and ethernet jacks in the front, and only the power jack in the rear. I have to blame Linksys for not giving this a completely different model name. For more info, see this Linksys article. I will have to return these and find a suitable alternative.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Format changed Sep 2018.  Now Ethernet connectors on the front along with the LEDs
customer_reviews.text: Somewhere between Jul 2018 and Sep 2018 the design of the SE3005 has changed, and now the Ethernet connectors come out the front. This is bad if you have this on your desk because now you have messy cables facing you, and usually there is tension on the cables that pull the switch to one side. I have one purchased in July 2018, and that has the connectors coming out of the back. Sending this back and try and find the "older" version where the connectors come out the back.
customer_reviews.author: Texan

customer_reviews.title: Decided to run my own ethernet wiring through the walls ...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to run my own ethernet wiring through the walls and needed some extra ports to handle the wiring in two parts of the house. I purchased two of these. I have speed tests between tow computers on my LAN. Both tests were through ethernet CAT 6 cables. There are 30 connected devices on my small network (ethernet or WiFi connected phones, speakers, iPads, laptops, desktop computers, set-top boxes, TVs, weather sensors, and a robot vacuum). The first test was between two desktop computers running off the same NAT router (before adding this switch) showed 980 Mbps throughput for upload and download; the test after installing the switch returned the same values.
customer_reviews.author: peaceful contemplator

customer_reviews.title: Half-Rack, Rack Mounted 16-Port Switch. Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product, but it was originally advertised as a "wall mounted" unit. Upon receiving the box I called support and asked them for a wall-mount kit, as it came with a rack mount. They did not have one, but offered a refund if I returned to Amazon. I needed the switch so I bought a NavePoint rack to wall adapter plate from Amazon. Overall the product works great. Just wish it came with a wall mount kit. Note: At the time of review, Linksys changed the ad so it reads correctly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gates

customer_reviews.title: The switch rocks me like a hurricane
customer_reviews.text: Great little switch. Now that we are dealing with Covid-19, I found myself and family "working from home". I ran some Ethernet since WiFi was not getting me the speeds that I needed for conference calls and VPN connections. I used this switch in the system and it works great. In the evenings my boys use it when gaming as there is only one shared Ethernet wire at that location. Neither have complained about any speed issues or loss in mindless gaming ability. The drool is still trickling out the sides of their mouths, so I guess it's treating them well.
customer_reviews.author: rtgreen12

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what i need.
customer_reviews.text: I see many reviews complaining the ports are on the front and not the back, If those people new what they were buying the complaining would stop. This is a network switch that is designed to be used in a data center/ server room. Am surprised the complainers even bought it when the pics clearly show the ports on the opposite side of the power input. This switch work great and does what it is made to do.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: I thought this was a great price for a 1Gig
customer_reviews.text: April '18 I thought this was a great price for a 1Gig, 16-port switch. Linksys should be an easy brand to buy too. The unit is OK. My one complaint is that it has dropped all connections twice since I bought it in Jan '18. That isn't the end of the world but my old switches never did that. I'll check back in a few months. Jun '18: I have to reset this switch too often. This isn't a value at all. It is the weak link in my network. Nov '18: I've not had to reset my switch since replacing the Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Grusin

customer_reviews.title: No configuration needed, just plug and play! (and download!)
customer_reviews.text: I used to use my old routers as switches thinking it was the same as using an unmanaged switch...oh I was wrong. I am using my 2 switches with my two towersand I have some devices like TVs, PS4 and PS3, and media players like Roku; everything works great with no additional configuration. I am using CAT 7 cables just in case the power lines could cause interferencealso the 3 meters for my printers. I hope now I can forget about my network
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Caballero

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit. Plug and play is always the way to go. Solid metallic body construction. Can be rack mounted, wall mounted, or just set on desk, table, shelf, etc. I ordered this switch to use with all my devices in entertainment system in one room. Was so impressed with it, I ordered another for the basement feed to send to other points in the house. Now I have an 8 port switch on my router, ( linksys EA9500 ), feeding an 8 port switch that feeds into another 8 port switch sending gig lines throughout the house. Have had both switches for close to a year with no problems and at this price point that's a win win.
customer_reviews.author: Lovethetech

customer_reviews.title: Great little thing to have!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I would be able to plug in more accessory items to my modem. The modem I have is a wonderful modem but it only has two USB ports! But with this little box, I am able to plug in four different auxiliary items, a Roku box, and android TV box, my DVD player etc. without any problems. No special set up required just plug it in and hook up your things . Great little gadget to have!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Casey

customer_reviews.title: Used it to add ethernet wired CCTV security cameras
customer_reviews.text: Came in handy to add 4 security cameras that were hardwired with ethernet Cat-6 cables to the CCTV NVR control box . I had to add the CCTV NVR control box to an already full router. So I took one laptop off the router and added the CCTV NVR control box ethernet cable to that port. Now have extra ports at my Linksys SE3008 8-Port Metallic Gigabit Switch to use too.
customer_reviews.author: Elector

customer_reviews.title: Not the current model
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. After reading some earlier reviews and the pictures in the listing, I thought for sure I would be getting the newer version of this switch. What I received is the old version with the connections in the front. This will not work with my current set up so I will be returning this for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Quit working within 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: I am a computer tech so I know how to troubleshoot. I have tried to reboot several times and it won't connect. Connecting the network cable directly to the computer works. I reported it to the vendor and they pointed me to tech support. It is not worth the time to sit on the phone with a "support technician" and have them read thru a script and doubt my experience. I will just buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: denlars

customer_reviews.title: This is a genuine non-blocking gigabit switch
customer_reviews.text: This is a genuine non-blocking switch. When a gigabit Network has a few slow devices (like, TV sets) some other routers will block packets from the same source while a packet is queued to a slow device. That is annoying, particularly when there are several of those slow devices. This router doesn't do that. Packets going to the slow devices do not block packets from the same Source going to other devices. You can actually get (close to) gigabit throughput, even with some slow devices in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Does not have lights on front as pictured by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the SE3008 because I needed lights on the front. Amazon substituted SE3008v2 which has lights on back (only) next to the connectors. v2 is slightly larger but rated at half the current draw (adapter is rated at only 0.3A). Otherwise the two versions appear to be the same. Update: while rewiring and installing, I realized that it was actually the connectors that were moved to the front with the lights. The back has only the power plug. So, to clarify, v2 has the power plug is on the back, the connectors and lights are on the front. It can be set on a shelf with rubber feet or wall mounted in any orientation with 2 screws.
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: Linksys 24 Port 10/100/1000 Switch. Works great and couldn't ask for better
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my Linksys 24-Port 10/100 to this model that is a 10/100/1000. Such a dramatic improvement and way overdue. I have been putting this off and glad I finally bit the bullet and the expense to do so. For those of you that do not know; Linksys is owned by Cisco. This is a great and reliable product. I waited to write my review after I have had this up and running for several days to give an honest and bias opinion.
customer_reviews.author: John Holt

customer_reviews.title: The switch ordered was not the switch sent.
customer_reviews.text: The switch ordered was the SE3008 but the switch received was the SE3008V2 in a SE3008 box. The SE3008 is designed for desktop use with the lights and ports on opposite sides (front and back) while the SE3008V2 is styled as a rack mount with the ports and lights on the same side.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckdog

customer_reviews.title: Works Flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: This switch works perfectly. I get all of my bandwidth from my ISP, which is >150 Mbps/20 Mbps. I have this running to a SlingBox, a gaming PC, and an Arlo security system in my theater/extra room. I did some homework first, and realized the newer/current version of this switch has the ports in the back, which is what I wanted. The picture the seller is showing is for the old version. I was hoping for the newer version to arrive, and it did.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wilks

customer_reviews.title: Works if I don’t touch it...
customer_reviews.text: If I just tilt this at all while it is running, it completely goes nuts and kills all my connected devices. And this isn’t the first time a cheap gigabit switch has done something like this to me. I find so darn difficult to get a quality desktop switch.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Alexzander

customer_reviews.title: However my wireless router does get very good speeds with this
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make every ethernet port in my house go live yet the only one that seems to work as the one connect to the wireless router. I tried connecting my TV and Blu-ray player but they just could not get wired internet. However my wireless router does get very good speeds with this. But if only one ethernet port is going to work, then there's no point to having this at all and I can just run it straight to my modem
customer_reviews.author: Bardia

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, great value and tech support
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing Linksys produces for year. They have lasted me many years and when I am stuck on an tech issue, their tech support has been solid and helpful. I purchased this switch box to replace my existing Linksys 8-port switch box. I just need more ports. After taking this out of the box, all I had to do was plug in the Ethernet devices and power it on and I was done.
customer_reviews.author: Demar G

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play!
customer_reviews.text: I use a 5 port and 8 port for my home network. They are just p0lug and play. next time I might go managed, but for what I do, these are great. I pay for 600Mbs service and never get less than 700Mbs. I like Linksys products. These are used with the Velop in home mesh system and between wired and wirless i am happy!
customer_reviews.author: Rockies

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Linksys 8 Port works great and the price was great. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This switch does exactly what you want it to do. The only thing I don't like about it is the network connections are in the front and power goes in the back. I wish everything went into the back with the LEDs on the front. That's my fault for not looking at it harder before I ordered it. Other than that it works exactly the way I want it to, so 5 stars is and easy rating for me.
customer_reviews.author: teri

customer_reviews.title: WELL DESIGNED; GUALITY
customer_reviews.text: RIGHT ITEM; RIGHT PRICE; EXPEDITIOUS DELIVERY; SIMPLE SET UP; LITERAL PLUG IN AND PLAY WITHOUT SOFTWARE; BOUGHT A RIGHT ANGLE POWER ADAPTER BECAUSE OF THE FRONT POWER INPUT AS I USE IT ON MY DESK AND WANT LESS WIRE CLUTTER, WORKS WELL; ALSO BOUGHT A ONE FOOT PATCH CORD TO CONNECT IT TO MY WIRELESS THAT SITS ON TOP OF THIS UNIT. THIS SWITCH WORKED RIGHT OFF THE START ONCE POWERED UP.
customer_reviews.author: JTFIII

customer_reviews.title: True plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation, appear to give me the speed my ISP is providing. The design would be fine in a full blown network room at the office as you may want to easily patch lines to another switch. Not a good design for home use. If they had to put the light in the back where I can't see them they should have also put the power jack in the rear as well.
customer_reviews.author: CCJones

customer_reviews.title: I like to get wired
customer_reviews.text: All I did was plug it in. Add cat 7 cable from router then used the other 4 opening for output to : (1) LG 4K Tv, (2) Sonos speaker, (3) Sony receiver (4) Canon printer. And then the other 3 outputs on router go to three other tv's. Yes they are all wireless devices, but you get much better signals wired. I use the wireless for 7 light switches, 10 receiptial, three smartphone, 5 kindled and a camera or to (6)
customer_reviews.author: Bad Bailey

customer_reviews.title: An important necessity
customer_reviews.text: When purchasing our Mesh System, we saw this advertised. We didn't know if we actually needed it at the time. Good thing we did. Turned out we used every port on this switch. We are so glad we purchased it. We are able to run many more things in our home using our router because of this switch.
customer_reviews.author: Ciaran Mackay

customer_reviews.title: Great for "expanding" Gigabit ports in your Local Network
customer_reviews.text: This Amazon-purchased switch is an additional switch for my home network (the other switch is an identical unit Purchased Elsewhere). All I did was unpack the unit, connect Ethernet cables to the External devices (up to 4), connect one port to the Main Router, plug in the unit, and INSTANT COMMUNICATION with my Home Network. Transfer speeds through the switch are quite fast and I don't notice any "data bottlenecks" with multiple devices using one router port.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Simmons

customer_reviews.title: v1 a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of se3008 for different areas of my house. when I ordered the last one it ended up being a version 2 ( I didnt see it anywhere in the post) the difference is the ports and lights are on the front instead of the back which I dont like at all. the v1 has the ports and power on the back and status lights on the front which made it cleaner for my application. the unit is still a great unit though.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Korsavidis

customer_reviews.title: very solid little unit for small businesses
customer_reviews.text: A really nice little switch for the small office, with gigabit speed you're not going to be slowed down and 16 ports is more than enough for most small places. The bonus that it uses a standard IEC cable is also great because it means no wall worts to take up valuable outlet space. Linksys is a trusted brand and so i have no reservations about there equipment. Bought several of these so far and no issues at all with them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M. Wollesen

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well day to day. I had one instance that my main switch went down and for some reason this one would not connect until I unplugged it and rebooted. Then it was fine. It's never done that again.
customer_reviews.author: Ldunham

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my network
customer_reviews.text: I tried to set up a wired network in my house with a router, the problem was that I was connecting it to a wireless router as well and even when I turned off router functionality it created problems for me. Once I did a little research, I found the best way to fix my problems was to find a switch and set it up as part of my network. Everything works great now. My set up is as follows: Cable modem -> Airport Extreme -> Linksys 8-Port Switch -> home distribution Having the router in between the modem and the switch was the key to getting this set up properly
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas G Frerman

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a wired switch I use in my entertainment system for all devices. Have a single cable running from my main switch to this and individual cables running to gaming systems, satellite receiver, blu-ray player, etc. Provides full wired speed with far less headache and lower latency than trying to get each device working and staying working with WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Working Awesome
customer_reviews.text: i never used one of these before and wanted to hard wire more things then my router would handle and also move my router away from my tv and gaming stuff.. i will just say one thing its awesome anyone could set it this its so easy , looks awesome and works awesome get one you will love it i have my pc ,xbox1,ps4,stereo ,tv,media-player and dish network all hooked up speeds are as fast as they were before and seems faster even
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: Linksys makes life easy.
customer_reviews.text: I only use Linksys products and they have served me well for the 17 years I've owned my software company. I'm not saying other products aren't good (and they may be equally good), but Linksys products make my life easy and that's what I'm looking for.
customer_reviews.author: W. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Replacing the old Cisco switch
customer_reviews.text: I've been using an old Cisco switch for some time and it was long overdue to be updated. As for setting this up, it's pretty much plug and play technology really. As I See It, if you have multiple ethernet plugs, you need a good switch and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: As I See It

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: Received it in 2 days, plug and play device, up and running in 5 minutes. I already owned one of these for almost 2 years, need to connect more than three ports from AirPort Extreme so went to trusted desktop switch, advantage is metal construction that won’t tilt the switch due to weight of cables, heat dissipation, light in the front will tell the activity. It is plug and play so no administration needed. If you need desktop switch this is the one to get over plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: I. Siddiqui

customer_reviews.title: Compact Switch, High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I spent a little more for quality and this product delivers. My network boots up quick upon restart. Usually these switches are the last thing to finish booting. I picked this style of switch for a reason. I need the lights on front and cables in back so I can see if there is information flowing to my tv components. No ugly cables showing on my sleek tv setup. The little tiny led lights that flash when data flows are not obtrusive and don't distract me when I'm watching my screen. Rubber feet keep it in one spot on the top of my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: AN

customer_reviews.title: The Network ports are in the front
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of the switches some time ago (same model). I bought this second one because the first one has been good. However, without explanation Linksys has changed the location of the ports from the back to the front. This is a pain when trying to run the cables and hide them. They should at least update the pictures so that costumers will know. This borderlines false advertisement. I kept it because I did not fell like going to the hazard of returning it again. Will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect. Fast, zero configuration, zero trouble.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fairly picky user of network equipment, but I don't typically benchmark, troubleshoot, or configure anything unless it explicitly gives me trouble. This switch arrived is a nice box, I hooked it up in about 3 minutes, replacing an old TP-Link switch that had died, and I was in business. I'm getting way faster speeds and lower ping times on all my devices than I was with the old switch. I haven't had to look at, think about, or touch this switch since those initial three minutes. Who can ask for anything more in a piece of networking equipment?
customer_reviews.author: D. Kong

customer_reviews.title: Simply works
customer_reviews.text: Simply works. Haven't had to bounce it like my Netgear gig switch. Nice to have status lights in front instead of having to rely on lights on the connector side (an ugly looking experience). Nice and quiet too - no screaming high pitch AC adapters like with Netgear. Transfer rate between my PC and my NAS is a bit better (say, just shy of 600Mbps) than with my Netgear (shy of 500Mbps). Windows and NAS are probably limiting factors in this anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Longtime Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace an old fast ethernet switch. Works great, has improved my in home game streaming and the internet speed on my desktop. Does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Music_Luver

customer_reviews.title: and ages of device they all work fine together when being switched through the Linksys 16-Port Gigabit ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a fully cat 6 wired home with two home offices and a home entertainment area at one end of our living room. We have devices that are 10 mbs, 100 mbs and 1,000 mbs including an 8 port linksys switch in both the second office and at the entertainment center. Our Internet connection is at 80 mbs on a gigabit router provided by my ISP. The bottom line is that despite the variety of manufacturers, bit rates, and ages of device they all work fine together when being switched through the Linksys 16-Port Gigabit Switch (SE3016).
customer_reviews.author: Robert Benson

customer_reviews.title: product worked right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived quickly and worked right out of the box. Excellent product required no configuaration. The head end connection needed no configuration to detect gigabit interface. The rest of the ports configured themselves to the desired speed as required by their devices.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Summers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up. Small footprint. Lots of ports.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Small footprint. Lots of ports. It is made for Linksys, so I expect it to last several years. I use it with a Linksys Velop Tri-band whole home wifi mesh system, which has only one ethernet out port but otherwise was everything I wanted for a home system (except for the high price). This bank of ports, by contrast, is inexpensive and works well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Otero

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly as all Linksys products do.
customer_reviews.text: Like all Linksys products it works like a charm. I used it to split my network for all the entertainment equipment in the living room from my office. No configuration required and works as any switch should. Now if only my internet provider can speed up my connection.
customer_reviews.author: Buckarubonzi

customer_reviews.title: Typical bulletproof Linksys product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to allow me to temporarily connect some computers I was working on. Worked perfectly and a very economical way to "network" different computers so I can move files and programs around over a network instead of doing installations one computer at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Old Jarhead

customer_reviews.title: plug and play
customer_reviews.text: I plugged my NAS, PC and Gateway into the SE3008 Switch. Powered it up and everything worked, immediately! My throughput from my PC to my NAS had been 11 MBps through the Gateway's router. Now it's 80+ MBps through the Lynksys switch.
customer_reviews.author: John Daly Jr

customer_reviews.title: Jacks on front
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the manufacturer's image, the jacks are on the front - version 1 according to the Linksys web site. That creates a patch cable mess in my home office. I wish they has shipped Version 2 with the lights on the front and jacks are on the rear.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great switch(5 Port) for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is for the 5 port switch. It works very well in allowing us to expand our Home network. I was able to add 2 printers that were wireless and a wall jack back into our network. I still have 1 port empty hmmmmm, what to do with that??? Solid construction and has the ability to be wall mounted. Does not come with an Ethernet cord, so plan accordingly
customer_reviews.author: Kermit M.

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Its a solid gigabyte switch, looks great and not worried about anything with this, very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Pyro

customer_reviews.title: DISLIKE NEW PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I have two of them and one was the last year 2017 I like it and the wire ports were in the back and now 2018 DISLIKE!!! I got the second one and it is front ports I really dislike it and too many wires on my desk it is so frustrating. but I still keep it anyway
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: The product is good but tech support needs improving
customer_reviews.text: I had a question about the correct way to install this and their tech support couldn't answer the question. I had to get a friend of mine that knows about these things to come over and help set it up. Not impressed with tech support at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Rylee

customer_reviews.title: Great switch.  Solid build, light enough to be stuck to a wall.  Front facing lights w/ rear facing ports.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking router. Easy to set up. Mine stays hidden away using Command Strips to keep it stuck on the backside of my media stand. It feels solidly built but it also is light enough for me to feel confident that it wont fall off anytime soon. The front-facing lights are convenient for these purposes as well, as I can just glance behind the media cabinet to see them without the need to try routing the cables upwards and against gravity.
customer_reviews.author: Will H

customer_reviews.title: The older version had a better design.
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting the LED lights in the front as shown in the picture, but the one I received had the ports in front and the power input at the back. in my opinion, the older version was designed better when it comes to cable placement. In this version, all the cables can't be hidden in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Poms

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Totally transparent way to add more 1G ports to my router/network. It is a nice looking box with a sturdy, all-metal case.
customer_reviews.author: DementedDad

customer_reviews.title: Works better than NetGear
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Much better than the NetGear unit that crapped out in less than a month. I've had this unit several months and it is still working!
customer_reviews.author: G. Isham

customer_reviews.title: Great switch
customer_reviews.text: Great little switch. I have 2 for my home to hardwire the devices I need stable fast internet to (work computer, family tv, sonos subnet) Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lots of blinking lights. Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Linksys has been amazing for years. Great product. Auto sensing ports are a far cry from the cross over cables from yesteryear. I’ll always be 100 with you.
customer_reviews.author: AcesInThePocket

customer_reviews.title: Think I got a bad one...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I have used many Linksys products but this one was a dud... The switch has several POE ports but it has a problem because I was trying to use only 5 ports and it would only power three devices... Something defective...
customer_reviews.author: Grady

customer_reviews.title: Works great A+
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this it Works great with no problems once I got it going but customer support is horrible and difficult to understand
customer_reviews.author: Tim Henkel

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm and solid
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play ease of use and works fine. Also, its a solid piece of equipment unlike the usual cheap plasticy made in China gear.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great switch for the money
customer_reviews.text: When our FiOS was upgraded with a router that had gigabit ports I needed to upgrade the small upstairs switch to match. Good price, nice small footprint and Linksys quality. Matching router to switch to new NIC's - the house network and Internet access is the fastest it's ever been. I compared several brands and went to this. I am not disappointed. I feel spoiled!
customer_reviews.author: Em K

customer_reviews.title: Ita a Lynksys 8 Port ;-)
customer_reviews.text: It does what is intended to do so, and my computers and home equipment stay on top speed. I recommend always wired over wireless but for my use and need this was right for me. My next switch would be POE port powered so I could link POE security cameras, no more power cables just direct connect and go.
customer_reviews.author: Blas

customer_reviews.title: Solid Switch that Prioritizes Video Streams
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. This switch had qos which is what I was looking for since I have a HD HomeRun in my finished attic that feeds my TVs and supports a qos stream...the switch also connects a printer. Everything just works after plugging it in. The device itself is also very solid and well made. It comes with some mounting screws, but I didn't use them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason J. Burt

customer_reviews.title: Top of class
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about an unmanaged switch but this one is metal and sturdy compared to the NG plastic equivalent at similar cost. This one performs well and does not feedback to router like NG can with multiple ports occupied with different types of traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: One of the five ports quit working after a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: One of the five ports quit working but since I can live with only four, I’m not sending it back. Otherwise, works fine as long as I don’t lose another port.
customer_reviews.author: MAT_Blue

customer_reviews.title: Linksys quality
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. This is for my work-from-home office so I don't mind spending a little extra. Everything works well so far, be sure to use the included power supply--not the one from the previous (failed) switch ;)
customer_reviews.author: Doug Bradley

customer_reviews.title: wrong pictures
customer_reviews.text: pictures and the actual device are different. pictures shows all power jack and all 8 internet jack are same side but the actual device is not.
customer_reviews.author: razmik

customer_reviews.title: The 8 port switch you needed is right here!!!
customer_reviews.text: Came with all parts including small rubber feet that can be attached if you prefer them and a wall mounting anchor kit. The kit could be better, but it is nice it came with one. The switch works great and I purchased 2 of them for a friends small business network and they are keeping the network up and helping with long term troubleshooting. they helped clean up some of the networking mess that was there before as well. I think they were a great investment and if you only need 8 ports then you have no reason to look for anything else unless your just trying to pinch pennies.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Tewksbury

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Used at end 150 feet of cat 7 cable to connect router to gaming computers—-500 Mbps all the way!!
customer_reviews.author: Edm

customer_reviews.title: Works as advetised
customer_reviews.text: Great item that allow for network expansion. Works well and is easily recognized by the network.
customer_reviews.author: KLG

customer_reviews.title: No front lights on this one
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these. One has activity LEDs on the front. I was surprised this one didn't. Same model number, different merchants. Functions fine.
customer_reviews.author: Randy G

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one month and now randomly fails. Cycling power ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one month and now randomly fails. Cycling power is only a temporary fix for a short time before it fails again. Getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: RDF

customer_reviews.title: Great hub.
customer_reviews.text: I love this hub. It is plug and play. There is a rating question about tech support, I'm sure its top notch but I wouldn't know because I didn't have to use it. Like I said plug and play. It was so easy and everything plugged into it is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon F.

customer_reviews.title: Speed up your LAN
customer_reviews.text: What good does gigablast do if your LAN is locked into 100 mByte hubs. Immediate improvement in LAN performance
customer_reviews.author: Mike Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Good price for 16 ethernet ports
customer_reviews.text: Support four simultaneous Tivo video streams and a Hubitat home automation hub paired with a Netgear Orbi satellite router network.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: My third Linksys unmanaged switch
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these before and just purchased the third for my home office. It's a fine product for whatever basic network operations it was created and produced.
customer_reviews.author: Giorgi

customer_reviews.title: Great 16 Port Switch
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a couple 8 port switches. Out of the box it worked perfect. Enough ports to handle all my needs, looks good and small enough to put just about anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play - works great! Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality metal switch. I just had to plug everything in and it worked flawlessly! Can’t ask for much more than that!
customer_reviews.author: cldsk

customer_reviews.title: Great switch. Great build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is excellent on this. Nice and heavy with the metal casing. I upgraded from a 5 port switch to this and couldn't be happier with my purchase. Definitely recommended to anyone looking for a quality switch. Plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: The Toan Ranger

customer_reviews.title: easy to install and get running
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy to install and get running. Great value for $$. Reliable. Used a smaller version before and was pleased too. Had to expand and this works very well.
customer_reviews.author: ahc7565

customer_reviews.title: It provides impressive downloading speed.
customer_reviews.text: Compared to an old Linksys WRT54G, the maximum download speed went up to 7 times, from 3 MB/s to 20 MB/s. It made me having a big smile out of amazement.
customer_reviews.author: kh

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do - works great in conjunction with my mesh network
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. I've had a coupel of these for quite awile and have never had any problems
customer_reviews.author: Every-day-normal-guy

customer_reviews.title: Easily connect 7 devices to your internet source
customer_reviews.text: The 8-port network switch is truly "plug and play". Plug in the power cord, plug in your internet source CAT5 cable into any port, add in your devices to be connected to the internet into any other ports. It would be nice if there were some way to see what speeds are being used - hence 4 stars. The ugly plugs are all on the back - just lights on the front side. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: J Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Very nice switch Plugin & Use - Router in Port 8 all devices have internet access
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 10/100 4 port switch. All these years I was like it was fine, I'll never know the difference. No comparison...period. Just by replacing Cat 5e with Cat 6 & this giga switch literally improved my hashing power as well as my stability. It was visible within 24 hrs
customer_reviews.author: Tim T

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Static IP
customer_reviews.text: It was very disappointing to find out after I purchased it, that it must run on DHCP
customer_reviews.author: David Greer

customer_reviews.title: Great splitter
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't manage off of a router, must be plugged into a smarter device than itself.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Easy.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a boss. Smart enough to matter where you plug which Ethernet (in vs out). Simple.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip A. Motsinger

customer_reviews.title: Easy and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: One of the easiest switches I have ever installed. Plugged in the power, plugged into my router and plugged in my devices. Everything worked from the start!
customer_reviews.author: John Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Great cost to performance ratio with this switch
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these unmanaged Gigabit network switches to replace a single managed 48-port fast ethernet switch. Installation was fast and easy. I like the placement of all lights and ports in the front of this switch, because you can tell at a glance if there is any problem with a connection or the speed of the connections. Price was great, too. Have had them in operation for a couple of weeks now without a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: YoYoDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Fast router, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no setup, and everything is faster now. Do bear in mind that you might not get full gigabit speed out of this due to other components on your computers and/or network setup. (My 5,400 RPM hard drive can't read data as fast as the router can send it, for example. Still, the network is faster than it was before.)
customer_reviews.author: Aaron DeMott

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and no issues
customer_reviews.text: You almost have to have one of these for all of your electronics in your entertainment center. Saves a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Swayrc51

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with Powerline Home Network
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and a few other prettier Linksys switches to use with the Linksys PLEK 500 powerline network adapters in my home. The LAN connection is fast and reliable, and the Internet download speed is about 12gbps. We have computers, printers, and Internet connected TVs and other AV equipment throughout the house, and this gear fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Prefection in a tiny box
customer_reviews.text: This switch is smaller than the switch it replaced (previous model). It also adds more functionality. Bought a second unit for a backup. I have switches on each end of the house to support high bandwidth usage and being down for just a day was painful to all. :-)
customer_reviews.author: jwh

customer_reviews.title: No wall mount option
customer_reviews.text: It my fault for assuming but its worthless to me without the ability to mount it on a wall. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I needed it to do. Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and does exactly what I needed it to do. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied, Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Very nice PoE switch Small and easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: LINKSYS 5-PORT ETHERNET SWITCH WORKS PERFECTLY.
customer_reviews.text: I am finally able to connect all my equipment to the router. I prefer Ethernet connection to Wireless for speed and security reasons so this switch filled my needs with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ware

product_meta.title: Linksys SE3008 8-Port Metallic Gigabit Switch,White
product_meta.description: Model:8-PortEasily add up to 8 devices to your home or office network. Simply plug-in to instantly connect devices to your network.
feature_bullets: Full-duplex IEEE 802.3x flow control and half-duplex backpressure with intelligent port-based congestion detection and broadcast rate control
All ports support auto MDI/MDI-X cable detection
Power Save: Advanced power saving mode detects unused ports
QoS: Prioritize video and audio applications for better streaming (IEEE 802.1p

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,113 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
